title: Fortnite porn searches rose during blackout, mainly for ‘Black Hole'
text:
Fortnite – the only thing more popular than porn

With Fortnite down for several days many wondered what fans would do without the game… the answer was apparently to look up porn.

Like it or not, video games are a very popular search subject when looking for online porn and even though it doesn’t really have any prominent named characters Fortnite, being one of the most popular games in the world, gets a lot of attention.

According to Pornhub, who always seem to have very detailed stats when it comes to video games – from Red Dead Redemption II to Bowsette – claims that the Fortnite blackout saw a 152% increase in searches for Fortnite related terms.

The most popular, inevitability, was ‘black hole’ which saw searches engorge by a massive 9,640%.

In their blog on the matter, Pornhub tactfully avoids describing what visitors would’ve found as a result of that search but apparently many of the searches were specifically for ‘fortnite black hole’, which implies people were hoping for something very specific.

There were two distinct bulges from Fortnite players (pic: Pornhub)

According to Pornhub the term ‘Fortnite’ is search for more than a million times every month, although, again, you dread to think what exactly it is they’re looking for.

Pornhub claims that traffic attributed to ‘gaming fans’ rose after the Fortnite servers shut down on Sunday evening, with an instant increase of 10.6%. They then remained higher than normal for 24 hours after that.

The opposite does also happen though, with the release of Fallout 4 in 2015 resulting in a 10% drop in Pornhub traffic.

Fortnite returned early yesterday, as Fortnite: Chapter 2, so presumably Pornhub’s searches have now fallen back to normal.

Although we’re not sure whether the biggest takeaway here is what Fortnite fans immediately think of when the game goes down or just how much statistical data Pornhub has on its visitors.
